BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h1>Bug Report</denchmark-h>
 
 <denchmark-h:h3>Which model does this pertain to?</denchmark-h>
 
 Mention the relevant onnx models from the model zoo here.
 yolo v4
 <denchmark-h:h3>Describe the bug</denchmark-h>
 
 I follow the instruction on post processing, but I get this:
 Traceback (most recent call last):
 File "inference.py", line 56, in 
 pred_bbox = utils.postprocess_bbbox(np.expand_dims(detections, axis=0), ANCHORS, STRIDES, XYSCALE)
 AttributeError: module 'core.utils' has no attribute 'postprocess_bbbox'
 <denchmark-h:h3>Reproduction instructions</denchmark-h>
 
 System Information
 OS Platform and Distribution (e.g. Linux Ubuntu 16.04):  Linux Ubuntu 18.04
 ONNX version (e.g. 1.6):  1.6
 Backend/Runtime version (e.g. ONNX Runtime 1.1, PyTorch 1.2):  ONNX Runtime
 Provide a code snippet to reproduce your errors.
 <denchmark-code>from core.config import cfg
 import core.utils as utils
 from PIL import Image
 
 ANCHORS = utils.get_anchors(cfg.YOLO.ANCHORS)
 STRIDES = np.array(cfg.YOLO.STRIDES)
 XYSCALE = cfg.YOLO.XYSCALE
 
 pred_bbox = utils.postprocess_bbbox(np.expand_dims(detections, axis=0), ANCHORS, STRIDES, XYSCALE)
 ...
 </denchmark-code>
 
 <denchmark-h:h3>Notes</denchmark-h>
 
 Any additional information

comments_0.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jennifererwangg>@jennifererwangg</denchmark-link>
   : Your inference jupyter notebook takes a dependency on "<denchmark-link:https://github.com/hunglc007/tensorflow-yolov4-tflite/blob/master/core/utils.py>https://github.com/hunglc007/tensorflow-yolov4-tflite/blob/master/core/utils.py</denchmark-link>
 " which was recently changed. Can you add a fix.
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/vinitra>@vinitra</denchmark-link>
  : What is the general practice here? How can we avoid taking such dependencies. This is a maintenance issue.

comments_1.comment_text: It would be great if the notebook contains the actual source code rather than the reference. The original author has the freedom to change their code at any time.

comments_2.comment_text:
Post process function in the original source code is using
 import tensorflow as tf
 for just post processing the onnx.run result. Better to re-write the post-process function with core python libs or in onnx.
 Main issue for me is to not to increase my container size by installing both Tensorflow libraries and Onnx runtime together.

comments_3.comment_text:
Thanks for the feedback, all! I agree that it's better not to take a dependency on other contributors' code that is subject to change. Following up with <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jennifererwangg>@jennifererwangg</denchmark-link>
  offline to resolve this.

comments_4.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/photoszzt>@photoszzt</denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-h:h1>[Cause of Issue]</denchmark-h>
 
 This issue is caused by the fact that functions  and  were removed from the  file under in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hunglc007/tensorflow-yolov4-tflite/commit/9ab36aaa90c46aa063e3356d8e7f0e5bb27d919b>commit 9ab36aaa90c46aa063e3356d8e7f0e5bb27d919b</denchmark-link>
  of .

comments_5.comment_text:
still minor bugs exist:
 fixed are in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/onnx/models/pull/349>#349</denchmark-link>
 
 
 Line 78 changed from import scipy to  from scipy import special Before "special" was not imported by default
 Line 216 changed from
 def draw_bbox(image, bboxes, classes=read_class_names(cfg.YOLO.CLASSES), show_label=True):
 to
 def draw_bbox(image, bboxes, classes=read_class_names("coco.names"), show_label=True):
 as label names are not stored in cfg object as in tensorflow or darknet original samples.
